questions.question: How can you customize the color of a line plot in Matplotlib?

answers.a: Use the `color` argument in the `plot()` function
answers.b: Use the `style` argument in the `plot()` function
answers.c: Use the `linecolor` argument in the `plot()` function
answers.d: You cannot change the color of a line plot

explanations.a: Correct! The `color` argument is used to set the color of a line in a plot.
explanations.b: The `style` argument is used to set line styles, not color.
explanations.c: There is no `linecolor` argument in the `plot()` function.
explanations.d: You can customize the color of a line plot.

questions.question: Which method would you use to add a title to a Matplotlib plot?

explanations.a: Correct! The `title()` function is used to add a title to the plot.
explanations.b: The `set_title()` method can also be used but is generally applied to axes objects.
explanations.c: There is no `add_title()` function in Matplotlib.
explanations.d: There is no `set_name()` function in Matplotlib.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about Matplotlib's subplot feature?

answers.a: Subplots allow you to create multiple plots in a single figure.
answers.b: You can only have one plot in a figure with subplots.
answers.c: Subplots are only used for scatter plots.

explanations.a: Correct! Subplots allow multiple plots to be displayed in a single figure, each in its own axis.
explanations.b: You can have multiple plots with subplots.
explanations.c: Subplots can be used for any type of plot, not just scatter plots.
